metadata.title: Framework B - ISO-style Security Controls
metadata.remarks: An ISO-style security framework used to demonstrate OSCAL control mappings as the target framework.

parts.prose: An access control policy shall be established, documented, and reviewed based on business and security requirements.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: User access management controls shall be established.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and controlled.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: System access controls shall be established.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Access to systems shall be controlled by secure authentication procedures.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Logging and monitoring controls shall be established.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, and security events shall be produced and kept.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Logging facilities and log information shall be protected against tampering and unauthorized access.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: System administrator and operator activities shall be logged and regularly reviewed.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Information classification controls shall be established.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: Information shall be classified in terms of legal requirements, value, criticality, and sensitivity.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information shall be developed.
parts.name: statement

parts.prose: A policy on the use, protection, and lifetime of cryptographic keys shall be developed.
parts.name: statement
